comment.author: 7776496@N03
comment._content: Not a "shell" jacket, they ended at the waist! That is a "sack" coat. If those trousers actually were blue, they are most likely a Union capture

comment._content: I wonder what that emblem on his hat represents? Corps badge? Rank?

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Enlarged, it looks like a St. George's cross -- I'd guess it's unit insignia.

comment.author: 14775694@N04
comment._content: You got sharper eyes than me. If it is a st george's cross then this man belonged to the 6th corps, Army of the Potomac. howardlanham.tripod.com/linkgr3/link151.html

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Maybe just more of an imagination -- but in the full size, enlarged a bit,  it looks like a light rectangle with a darker cross centered in it -- more like the English flag than the one your link, but could be.

comment._content: No -- looks more like this one, I think: georgiainfo.galileo.usg.edu/engflag.htm But I certainly wouldn't swear to it.
